user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of add_new_user_entry:
```c
static int
add_new_user_entry (const char *const username,
                    const char *const password,
                    const char *const realm,
                    int allow_area_1,
                    int allow_area_2)
{
  struct UserEntry *entry;
  enum MHD_Result res;

  if ((sizeof(user_ids) / sizeof(user_ids[0])) <= user_ids_used)
    return 0; /* No more space to add new entry */

  entry = user_ids + user_ids_used;

  entry->username = username;
  entry->realm = realm;

  res = MHD_YES;

  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5,
                                         username,
                                         realm,
                                         entry->userhash_md5,
                                         sizeof(entry->userhash_md5));
  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5,
                                           username,
                                           realm,
                                           password,
                                           entry->userdigest_md5,
                                           sizeof(entry->userdigest_md5));

  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256,
                                         username,
                                         realm,
                                         entry->userhash_sha256,
                                         sizeof(entry->userhash_sha256));
  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256,
                                           username,
                                           realm,
                                           password,
                                           entry->userdigest_sha256,
                                           sizeof(entry->userdigest_sha256));

  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256,
                                         username,
                                         realm,
                                         entry->userhash_sha512_256,
                                         sizeof(entry->userhash_sha512_256));
  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res =
      MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256,
                                       username,
                                       realm,
                                       password,
                                       entry->userdigest_sha512_256,
                                       sizeof(entry->userdigest_sha512_256));

  if (MHD_NO == res)
    return 0; /* Failure exit point */

  entry->allow_area_1 = allow_area_1;
  entry->allow_area_2 = allow_area_2;

  user_ids_used++;

  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I found no uses of compiler language extensions in the provided code. Specifically checked and reasons: 
- No identifier or keyword that is a compiler extension (no __attribute__, __asm, __extension__, __builtin_*, typeof, __typeof__, or identifiers beginning with double underscore).
- No inline assembly, no statement-expressions ({ ... }) used as expressions, no nested functions, no labels-as-values (&&label), no computed goto, no vector extensions, and no other vendor-specific keywords.
- Macro names (e.g. MHD_YES, MHD_NO, MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash, MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5) are normal identifiers/macros and not language extensions themselves.
- Use of const qualifiers (const char *const), enum, sizeof, pointer arithmetic, and the return expression (return ! 0;) are all standard C constructs, not compiler extensions.

Therefore there are no suspicious fragments to investigate for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 (language extensions).
